indicator description:
2013 Urban Influence Codes
Metropolitan Counties
1: In large metro area of 1+ million residents
2: In small metro area of less than 1 million residents
Nonmetropolitan Counties
3: Micropolitan area adjacent to large metro area
4: Noncore adjacent to large metro area
5: Micropolitan area adjacent to small metro area
6: Noncore adjacent to small metro area and contains a town of at least 2500 residents
7: Noncore adjacent to small metro area and does not contain a town of at least 2500 residents
8: Micropolitan area not adjacent to a metro area
9: Noncore adjacent to micro area and contains a town of at least 2500 residents
10: Noncore adjacent to micro area and does not contain a town of at least 2500 residents
11: Noncore not adjacent to metro or micro area and contains a town of at least 2500 residents
12: Noncore not adjacent to metro or micro area and does not contain a town of at least 2500 residents
Descripción traducida: Códigos de influencia urbana 2013 (13 categorías de urbanización de condados)

indicator description:
2015 ERS County Typology Codes Update
Classification of counties by metro or nonmetro definition
1=metro county (Urban); metro areas include all counties containing one or more urbanized areas: high-density urban areas containing 50000 people or more; metro areas also include outlying counties that are economically tied to the central counties as measured by the share of workers commuting on a daily basis to the central counties.
0=nonmetro county (Rural); Nonmetro counties are outside the boundaries of metro areas and have no cities with 50000 residents or more.
Descripción traducida: Código de tipología 2015 del ERS: condado metropolitano

indicator description:
2015 ERS County Typology Codes Update
Non-overlapping economic-dependence county indicator
0=Nonspecialized
1=Farm-dependent
2=Mining-dependent
3=Manufacturing-dependent
4=Federal/State government-dependent
5=Recreation
Descripción traducida: Código de tipología económica 2015 del ERS (dependencia de ingreso/industria)

indicator description:
2015 ERS County Typology Codes Update
Farm-dependent county indicator
0=no
1=yes Faming accounted for at 25% or more of the county's earnings or 16% or more of the employment averaged over 2010-2012.
Descripción traducida: Código de tipología agrícola 2015 del ERS (dependencia del ingreso agrícola)

indicator description:
2015 ERS County Typology Codes Update: Manufacturing-dependent county indicator.
0=no
1=yes.  Manufacturing accounted for 23% or more of the county's earnings or 16% of the employment averaged over 2010-12.
Descripción traducida: Código de tipología manufacturera 2015 del ERS (dependencia del ingreso manufacturero)

indicator description:
2015 ERS County Typology Codes Update: Recreation county indicator
0=no
1=yes.  See documentation page: http://www.ers.usda.gov/data-products/county-typology-codes.aspx
Descripción traducida: Código de tipología de recreación 2015 del ERS

indicator description:
2015 ERS County Typology Codes Update
Population loss county indicator.
0=no
1=yes. Number of resident declined between the 1990 and 2000 censuses and also between the 2000 and 2010 censuses.
Descripción traducida: Declive poblacional (según documentación del ERS)

indicator description:
2015 ERS County Typology Codes Update
Retirement destination county indicator.
0=no
1=yes. Number of resident 60 and older grew by 15 percent or more between 2000 and 2010.
Descripción traducida: Crecimiento de población de 60+ años entre 2000 y 2010

indicator description:
2015 ERS County Typology Codes Update
Classification of counties by level of poverty over three decades where
1=persistent poverty county; a county was classified as persistent poverty if 20 percent or more of its residents were poor as measured by the 1980 1990 and 2000 decennial censuses and the American Community Survey 5-year estimates for 2007-11
0=all other counties;
Descripción traducida: Clasificación de pobreza persistente a lo largo de tres décadas

indicator description:
2015 ERS County Typology Codes Update
Classification of counties by level of poverty over three decades where
1=persistent related child poverty county; a county was classified as persistent related child poverty if 20 percent or more of related children under 18 years old were poor as measured by the 1980 1990 and 2000 decennial censuses and the American Community Survey 5-year estimates for 2007-11. See the Census Bureau website (http://www.census.gov/hhes/www/poverty/methods/definitions.html) for details about the poverty population universe as it pertains to related children and treatment of unrelated individuals under age 15.
0=all other counties;
Descripción traducida: Clasificación de condado con pobreza infantil persistente durante tres décadas
